website_summaries.verdict: Great price for a big replacement hammer handle that is made for really large hammer heads.
pros: Handle measures 16 inches in length, so this replacement piece is made to fit really big hammer heads
Consists of American hickory wood with a durable finish on it, which means it will continue to look good over time
Ships with both metal and wood wedges, allowing you to pick the style that will work best for your hammer head
cons: Will not fit smaller or average sized hammer heads

customer_reviews.title: Hickory hammer handle
customer_reviews.text: The hickory hammer handle shipped out and arrived on time. Shipped in a plain mailer envelope. The handle looks okay but has globs of cheap varnish or some kind of coating. I sanded the varnish off the entire handle and then fitted it to the head. It fit as it should (after a little work) . I used a conical wedge instead of the metal wedge it came with. I prefer them to the little metal wedges. Afterwards I applied several coats of boiled linseed oil. So far it's holding up and doing it's job.
customer_reviews.author: LLP

customer_reviews.title: Quality wooden handle that fit tightly with a little work. Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece of wood with a decent finish! Had to shave it down a bit but then it fit very snugly into the head. When I finished there was 1/2" sticking out the top and a little room to spare at the bottom. I coated the inside of the head with black marker and finding high spots on the handle was easy. I used a carbide burr for the reshaping. When I finished it off I applied a coating of JB Weld epoxy. I don't think it's going anywhere! I recommend if you like saving good old tools...
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Ooop's or Better luck next time.!
customer_reviews.text: Well once upon a time I had this old hammer. Used it for years with the tattered old handle.then one day my help busted it .so after seeing that old hammer head laying around for years .I decided to buy your handle and get her all fixed up..long story short I got 11 hits on the cast iron pipe before it broke again..it looked nice
customer_reviews.author: ca jones

customer_reviews.title: A high quality handle at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that I found this on Amazon. It fit my hammer perfectly and saved me from having to replace my old hammer. It's a fine wooden handle with a really nice finish on it. It fit my old hammer perfectly. I've been searching hardware stores for years for a handle like this and I finally found this one here on Amazon at an amazingly low price.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Wright

customer_reviews.title: The handle was fairly easy to shape
customer_reviews.text: The handle was fairly easy to shape, at the oval eye insertion end, with an 80 grit belt on a belt sander. Hickory is tough, so there might be some familiar smoky fragrance as you grind away the area for fit. Going slow so as not to mess up this brand new handle, it took about half an hour from start to finish to fit the 2# head onto this handle with some reshaping. So, for less than $10, and two days to get to me, with a 30 minute project time, my 2# hammer is ready for camping season!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replacement for a blacksmith hammer...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect heavy duty replacement handle!!! The handle on my blacksmith hammer finally broke after 20 years of abuse and this was a perfect replacement. I had to do very reshaping to the end to get a perfect fit. Nice heavy duty hickory handle...
customer_reviews.author: Bitwave

customer_reviews.title: this is a nice handle
customer_reviews.text: used on a 4lb hammer hanging iron for the last 6 months and still hanging in there.just make sure you wrap the handle under the hammer head with electrical tape,we all miss every once in a while.even me!
customer_reviews.author: chris hadden

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit the hammer head.
customer_reviews.text: I have to trim the wood to fit it in the hammer head. Broker when pulling out a nail. My prior ash handle lasted years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hammer Handle
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted and exactly what I expected. Old School, bad-to-the-bone hickory handle for m 4# hammer head. quick shipment and I must admit "over packaged" (big box, handle wrapped in bubble wrap... I had to chuckle... hickory handle wrapped in bubble wrap!!!). Someone had a sense of humor...
customer_reviews.author: MOCIII

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Ahhh, gotta love Hickory. Perfect fit, did not need to shape anything. Hammered it on, cut the excess and installed the wedges. Couldn’t be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Rob O.

customer_reviews.title: 3 lb hammer head
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Easy to do, recommend using apoxy once you get it set.comes with a metal and wood shim.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice handle and they give you two different wedges
customer_reviews.text: Nice handle and they give you two different wedges; a wood one and a metal one. Sure nice to have a new handle.
customer_reviews.author: batyahTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Broke faster than the original. Looks like it had an internal fracture that ran the length of the handle from the start.
customer_reviews.author: A Concerned Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality handle.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality handle that saved a great hammer head. Ah, the days of repairing a quality tool instead of simply throwing it away only to buy a new one that is nowhere as good as the one you threw away!
customer_reviews.author: Felson99

customer_reviews.title: High quality wooden handles.
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality American Hickory handles that are very functional and comfortable in the hand. They are definitely designed for heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: started refinishing my fathers old hammers, these handles work great
customer_reviews.author: William M. Doody

customer_reviews.title: good stick
customer_reviews.text: good handle,. DON'T buy extra wedge, it comes with one.
customer_reviews.author: magnacharger

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made hickory handle
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made hickory handle, works very well. Only reason it didn't get a 5 is it required more trimming top fit than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Heronymous

customer_reviews.title: Good quality handle.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 3 pound hammer. It fit well and was good quality. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: arcorabin

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: hard to tell the exact size going into the head, was able to use on another head
customer_reviews.author: waimanalo carpenter

customer_reviews.title: ... to fit but it is on and is a good quality
customer_reviews.text: Had to sand it down a lot to fit but it is on and is a good quality handle
customer_reviews.author: Marco T.

customer_reviews.title: decent handle
customer_reviews.text: I don't make my living with it so grain orientation off a bit is OK. Otherwise, a good handle.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalBill

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a hammer handle other than it works.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality handle
customer_reviews.text: Fit my four pound hammer, saved driving around different hardware stores to find this handle. I paid about three dollars more but saved in gas $$.
customer_reviews.author: Larry P. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Hammer handle
customer_reviews.text: This hammer handle is as described. It works fine and has not slipped since it was installed. However the local hardware store has them for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome handles.
customer_reviews.text: One of these I used to fit the proper hammer and the other I modified to fit another. Both work excellent, comes with the wooden wedge AND the steels so you can really fit these well.
customer_reviews.author: David Greene

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice tight fit on my antique hammer and has a smooth grip as well. Feels solid.
customer_reviews.author: matt w

customer_reviews.title: Fits, but only marginally. The oval in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits, but only marginally. The oval in the sledge will require some epoxy to fill the space. The handle is a narrower ellipse than the head.
customer_reviews.author: William R McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my custom hand forged tomahawk. Very happy with my purchase. Price is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: NICE PIECE OF WOOD
customer_reviews.text: GOOD STURDY HANDLE . USED FOR A 4 LB ENGINEERING HAMMER HEAD . WILL ORDER IT AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Crawford

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: simple solid handle considering the price. Have put this on a 1kg hammer I use to blacksmith with and the handle has held up for quite a whiloe now even though it gets quite a work-out
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Solid..
customer_reviews.text: A very solid handle at a very good price what else do you want?
customer_reviews.author: seerock

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great handle, put my sledgehammer back into service no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Duran

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came with wood and metal wedges for confident fit and installation (don't want to think about the alternative!)
customer_reviews.author: Carol and David Melvin

customer_reviews.title: great handle
customer_reviews.text: good straight kerf and good clear wood. great handle for the price. I hope it holds up to years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Frost

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Match
customer_reviews.text: The shape was identical to the one I replaced. I figured I'd have to work a bit to get it to fit but no, it could have been turned on the same lathe. The hickory though... was light and I suspect not as strong as the original I replaced. That's just something that happens though when dealing with natural materials.
customer_reviews.author: bd_doolin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 32 oz ball peen perfectly, a lot cheaper then a new hammer
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang

customer_reviews.title: Good quality handle.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good handles, but replacing a handle is a lot more work than I expected it to be. If you've never done it before I would probably recommend just buying a new tool instead of dealing with the hassle of replacing the handle.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: Hammer time
customer_reviews.text: Needed a replacement handle for my small sledge head and this was a perfect purchase with the longer handle giving me extra driving power with each swing.
customer_reviews.author: Colin
